details.summary: The UK's network in France and Monaco supports the government's main aims overseas: keeping Britain safe, making Britain prosperous and helping British nationals.
details.description:
We advise the UK government on French policy, and increasing Franco-British work in areas such as foreign policy, the EU, science and innovation, energy, sustainable development, climate change, illegal immigration and counter-terrorism. We also issue visas for the UK to foreign nationals.

Our UK Trade & Investment team promotes trade and investment.

We help British nationals by providing consular services to those who have been involved in crime or other serious incident.

This work is carried out by staff at the embassy and the consulate general in Paris, in our consulates in Bordeaux and Marseille and in our British Trade and Investment Office in Lyon. There is also a separate UK delegation to the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development and UK Delegation to the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization, and a permanent delegation to the Council of Europe in Strasbourg and the British Council, which has offices in Paris, Lyon and Marseille.
details.services:
Travel advice for France

Information, news and updates for France to ensure you stay safe, avoid problems, and make informed decisions when living or travelling in France.

Documentation for getting married in France

Understand what you need to get married in France. Read the guidance from the British Consulate in Paris

Support and information when someone dies in France

If a relative or friend dies while they are in France, we can help you cope with some of the steps involved.

Support and information when someone is detained or arrested in France

If a relative or friend is detained or arrested while you are in France, the Prisoner Pack gives details of the French legal and prison systems.

Support and information after a rape or sexual assault in France

If you, a friend or relative has been the victim of rape or sexual assault in France, please contact your nearest consulate by telephone. You should also read our leaflet on rape and sexual assault abroad.

Emergency travel documents

Information about how to get an Emergency Travel Document if your UK passport is lost or stolen.

Passports

For information on how to apply for your first passport or renew an existing passport, please visit the passport section of this website. Please note that the British embassy and consulates in France cannot answer enquiries about passport applications.

Out-of-hours emergency assistance

British nationals who need emergency assistance outside normal office hours should call +33 1 44 51 31 00 where they will be given details on how to proceed and how to contact a duty officer if needed.

Registering a birth or death

Understand your legal requirements, how you can register a birth or how to register a death that happened in France.

Notarial and documentary services

Find information about the notarial services that the British consulates can provide. If you do not have a specific requirement for a Consular officer to carry out the service, you may find it cheaper and easier to contact a local notaire or lawyer.

Visas

For information on whether you require a visa for the United Kingdom and how to apply go to the UK Border Agency website

General information for people living in France

A general set of information and links for British nationals who live in France.

How else we can help

In addition to the services listed above we can also:

  • provide information about transferring funds
  • provide appropriate help if you are the victim of a crime or are in hospital
  • help people with mental illness
  • do all we properly can to contact you within 24 hours of being told that you have been detained
  • offer support and help in a range of other cases, such as child abductions, death of relatives overseas, missing people and kidnapping
  • contact family or friends for you if you want
  • make special arrangements in cases of terrorism, civil disturbances or natural disasters

UK law says we have to charge for some services. Details of our current fees and the standards of service you can expect to receive are on display in our Consular section.

What our consular section cannot do for you:

Although we try to help British nationals in a wide range of situations, we cannot:

  • get you out of prison, prevent the local authorities from deporting you after your prison sentence, or interfere in criminal or civil court proceedings
  • help you enter a country, for example, if you do not have a visa or your passport is not valid, as we cannot interfere in another country’s immigration policy or procedures
  • give you legal advice, investigate crimes or carry out searches for missing people, although we can give you details of people who may be able to help you in these cases, such as English-speaking lawyers
  • get you better treatment in hospital or prison than is given to local people
  • pay any bills or give you money (in very exceptional circumstances we may lend you some money from public funds, which you will have to pay back)
  • make travel arrangements for you, or find you work or accommodation
  • make business arrangements on your behalf

Public enquiries

The embassy press and communications office is responsible for the phone or email enquiries from the general public. Please note that we do not answer enquiries about passport or visa applications. You can contact us on + 33 01 44 51 32 81, Monday to Friday, 10am until 4pm (service closed in August). You can also send an email to: Public.Paris@fco.gov.uk

details.access_and_opening_times:
Opening times

Monday to Friday, 9:30am to 1pm and 2:30pm to 6pm

2013 public holidays

The British Embassy Paris and the British consulates will be closed on the following public holidays.

In case of emergency: Please call +33 (0)1 44 51 31 00

  • Tuesday 1 January
  • Friday 29 March
  • Monday 1 April
  • Wednesday 1 May
  • Thursday 9 May
  • Monday 20 May
  • Monday 27 May
  • Thursday 15 August
  • Monday 26 August
  • Friday 1 November
  • Monday 11 November
  • Wednesday 25 December
  • Thursday 26 December
  • Friday 27 December

Getting to the embassy

Parking

Unfortunately there is no parking spaces available in the Faubourg. The nearest public car park is at Place de la Concorde (on the angle of avenue Gabriel) which provides a 24-hour service. Visit the Vinci website for more details.

Bus

For those of you who prefer to travel by bus, the following lines will get you close to the embassy: 24, 42, 52, 72, 73, 84, 94 or consult the RATP website in order to plan a more personalised route.

Metro

The nearest metro stations are Madeleine (lines 8, 12, 14), Concorde (line 1), Miromesnil (lines 9, 13) and Champs-Elysees (lines 1, 13). Route maps and service information can be found on the RATP website.

Train

The nearest train station is Saint Lazare which is about a 10-minute walk from the embassy. Service information can be found on the Transilien website.

Disabled access

For disabled persons, wheelchair access and assistance is available on request in all our buildings.

Where we are

British Embassy, 35 rue du Faubourg Saint Honoré 75008 Paris.

Parking

Unfortunately there is no parking spaces available in the Faubourg. The nearest public car park is at Place de la Concorde (on the angle of avenue Gabriel) which provides a 24-hour service. Visit the Vinci website for more details.

Bus

For those of you who prefer to travel by bus, the following lines will get you close to the embassy: 24, 42, 52, 72, 73, 84, 94 or consult the RATP website in order to plan a more personalised route.

The nearest train station is Saint Lazare which is about a 10-minute walk from the Embassy. Service information can be found on the Transilien website.

For disabled persons, wheelchair access and assistance is available on request in all our buildings.

details.access_and_opening_times:
The Trade and Investment Office (Délégation Commerciale du Royaume-Uni à Lyon) is the New Technologies Office of UKTI for the whole of France. UKTI France New Technologies: Turning Science into Business into Exports

We assist British companies in new, emerging and innovative technologies, notably Life Sciences, Healthcare, Medical & Scientific instruments, Biotechnology, Pharmaceuticals, ICT, Communications, Electronics, Environment, Water, Chemicals and Advanced Materials; analyse their needs and best path to market and provide operational assistance to access the French market.

In addition the Office identifies Inward Investment opportunities in the Rhône-Alpes region and passes them through to the UKTI Investment Department at the Embassy. We maintain good relationships with French companies present in the UK and the local government commercial agencies.

Please note that consular services for this region are being provided by staff at the British Consulate in Marseille.

Opening times

Visits are by appointment only, please call +33 (0)4 72 62 99 55 for a meeting.

Parking

Brotteaux car park immediately outside the offices.

Bus

C1 trolley bus.

Metro

Line B (Brotteaux).

Train

5-10 minute walk from the mainline station (Part-Dieu).

Disabled access

Yes.

2013 public holidays

The British Embassy Paris and the British consulates will be closed on the following public holidays.

  • Friday 29 March
